questions.q: A company wants to purchase some network hardware to which they can plug 30 PCs in your department. Which network device is appropriate?
questions.explanation: Switches have many network interfaces (usually 24+) and are used to aggregate connections for end hosts within the same LAN.

questions.q: You received a video from your friend's Apple iPhone using Airdrop. What was his iPhone functioning as in this transaction?
questions.explanation: In this transaction, the sender functions as a server because it provides the function or service (the video) to the recipient.

questions.q: Your company wants to purchase some network hardware to connect its separate networks together. What kind of network device is appropriate?
questions.explanation: Routers are specifically designed to provide connectivity between different LANs and direct data packets across network boundaries.
Host nodes (or endpoints) are addressable devices on a network, such as clients or servers.

questions.q: A network within a city of area around 30 kilometers, is more likely to be...
questions.explanation: Metropolitan Area Networks (MAN) connect LANs across a city and typically span a range of 5 to 50 kilometers.

questions.q: A software application that filters traffic entering and exiting a PC is
questions.explanation: Host-based firewalls are software applications that filter traffic specifically entering and exiting a host machine.

questions.q: The topology in which nodes are only connected to the nodes they interact with most is known as...
questions.explanation: In a partial mesh topology, nodes are only connected to the specific nodes they communicate with frequently.

questions.q: The topology in which nodes are connected in a circular pattern is...
questions.explanation: Devices are connected in a circle, and packets travel through the ring until they reach their destination.

questions.q: The topology that consists of a central hub or switch, through which all of the data passes, along with all of the peripheral nodes connected to that central node is...
questions.explanation: This topology uses a central hub or switch as a common wiring point for all connected devices.

questions.q: A campus network that is reside in an area around 800 meters, is more likely to be...
questions.explanation: Local Area Networks typically cover limited areas such as a building or campus up to approximately 1,000 meters.

questions.q: A data has been encapsulated with three separate headers and one trailer. What is the appropriate name for this PDU?
questions.explanation: During encapsulation, the Data Link layer adds its own header and a trailer to the packet (which already contains the L4 and L3 headers).

questions.q: The Link Layer of the TCP/IP Model is equivalent to which layer in the OSI Model
questions.explanation: The Link layer in the TCP/IP suite corresponds to both the Physical and Data Link layers of the OSI model.

questions.q: The Layer that provides a node-to-node connectivity in the OSI Model is...
questions.explanation: This layer provides node-to-node connectivity and handles data transfer between devices like a PC to a switch.

questions.q: The Layer that provides a host-to-host connectivity in the OSI Model is...
questions.explanation: The Transport layer is responsible for end-to-end or host-to-host communication.

questions.q: The Layer that is responsible for establishing, managing, terminating connections is....
questions.explanation: The Session layer controls the dialogues (sessions) between communicating hosts.
